page.title: 05BLYTH'S FARM
page.content: Blyth's Farm Blyth's Farm covers 250 acres.The only livestock is Fresian cows,but the family keep poultry for themselves.There are 100 cows and they each produce 1100 gallons of milk a year.Each cow has a calf every year.The farm also has bulls.They grow six different crops,wheat,barley,sugar beet,kale,lucerne and rye grass.Only two of these products are sent away from the farm.Wheat is exported and sugar beet is sent to the British Sugar Corparation.All the milk is sent to the Milk Marketing Board.The other four crops feed the cows throughout the year.The family has lived on the farm for 66 years.There are five full time and three part time workers on the farm.
